content:
Verify Email Addresses to Meet the Email Verification Requirement

To complete enforcement of the email verification requirement introduced in the Spring '22 major release, Salesforce now requires all users in all orgs and Experience Cloud sites to verify their email address. If a user sends an email from an unverified email address, Salesforce rejects this email message and doesn’t complete the send.

This change is available in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) in all editions. It applies to all users in all orgs and Experience Cloud sites, including employee, customer, and partner users across sandbox and production instances.

In past releases, Salesforce enforced this requirement for all orgs and Experience Cloud sites except for paid production instances with single sign-on (SSO) users. With the Summer ’24 release, Salesforce now enforces the requirement for all orgs and Experience Cloud sites, including all paid production instances with SSO users.

As a Salesforce admin, you can check a user’s email verification status by viewing the user’s details. Users can also see their own email verification status from the Advanced User Details page.

For unverified users, you have several options for verifying their email address, including initiating verification or using async email methods to customize the verification email template and automate the process. You can also verify multiple users at once using DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) to automatically verify all email addresses that belong to a specific domain.
title: Email Verification Requirement for All Users
